summary: This bill, the Codifying Useful Regulatory Definitions Act (CURD Act), aims to define "natural cheese" within the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. It provides a specific definition, outlining production methods and ingredients allowed, and excludes various processed cheese products. Furthermore, it modifies food labeling regulations to ensure accurate use of the term "natural cheese" on packaging and adds a provision regarding national uniformity. Congress aims for transparency and consistency to enable consumers to differentiate between natural and processed cheese.
